node.title: 'They didn't really know what they were getting': How this country girl became a ballet star
node.alt: A female ballet dancer poses on stage
node.description: Leanne Benjamin first took to the stage as a child in Rockhampton. With a natural talent and dedication, she became one of the Royal Ballet's most celebrated ballerinas. Now she's reliving the journey from central Queensland to Covent Garden.
node.content:
["A little girl stands on the edge of a stage, wearing ballet slippers with white socks neatly folded, a puff-sleeved dress covered in printed animals and curled hair in ribbons.", "There's no hint in the photograph that this four-year-old from Rockhampton will one day perform for royalty and celebrities as an acclaimed ballerina.", "", "
Leanne Benjamin, 4, is congratulated by adjudicator Jill Cadden on her first performance in the Rockhampton Eisteddfod.\u00a0(Supplied: Leanne Benjamin's personal archive)
", "It was taken at the Rockhampton Eisteddfod in 1968 and was published in the local newspaper with the headline: The Tiniest Competitor.", "That tiny dancer was Leanne Benjamin.", "Twelve years later, at the age of 16, she left central Queensland for London's Royal Ballet School, carrying a single black suitcase full of \"a lot of badly fitting corduroy\" and a fur coat, to prepare for an English winter.", "Now retired from performing and training future prima ballerinas, Benjamin has relived those early memories in her recently published autobiography Built for Ballet.", "
A talented family
", "Benjamin followed in the footsteps of her older sister, Madonna, at the prestigious ballet academy.", "The sisters were three and five years old respectively when they started dancing, doing Saturday lessons in a one-room studio underneath a Rockhampton house.", "Eventually, those once-a-week classes morphed into multiple classes in a mix of styles, and finally into strict 6.30am ballet training with Valeria Hansen.", "Despite her dedication and natural talent, Benjamin admitted a career in dance didn't cross her mind until her mid-teens.", "Professional ballet was always Madonna's dream, with Benjamin describing her sister as \"really talented and completely dedicated\".", "", "
Leanne Benjamin performs in Las Hermanas.\u00a0(Supplied:\u00a0Leslie E. Spatt)
", "\"She knew everything about the art of ballet,\" Benjamin said.", "\"I didn't really know anything.", "It was Valeria Hansen who encouraged the sisters to apply for the Royal Ballet School.", "By the time the younger sibling left Rockhampton to take up her place, moving across the world didn't seem like such a big deal.", "Madonna's departure had all the fanfare and Leanne was \"riding the wave after her\".", "\"I was so, so excited to leave,\" Benjamin said.", "\"I've always been someone that's very curious about what goes on and I love starting a new chapter.\"", "
'They didn't really know what they were getting'
", "These days, auditions for the Royal Ballet School are rigorous \u2013 particularly for international students, who must be prepared to travel to London for intense two-day auditions.", "", "
Leanne Benjamin performing in Qualia in\u00a02003\u00a0with Edward Watson. She\u00a0had given birth to her son Thomas just five months earlier.(Supplied:\u00a0Bill Cooper / ArenaPAL)
", "But in 1979, the process was one Benjamin described as \"very primitive\".", "\"All I had to do was send three photographs of myself in various balletic positions,\" she said.", "\"I was incredibly fortunate. I mean, they didn't really know what they were\u00a0getting until they arrived.\"", "Where Rockhampton was bright, hot and dry, London was cold, grey, and rainy.", "But one thing was universal: the ballet studio.", "\"As soon as I walked into that studio, I just didn't look back,\" she said.", "\"It was amazing, and it was just such a contrast. In Rockhampton, I was the only girl left standing in the ballet lessons for about eight months with my teacher.", "Benjamin went on to become one of the Royal Ballet's most celebrated ballerinas and spent two decades as a principal before retiring at the age of 49.", "
Reliving the memories
", "Writing an autobiography requires digging through old memories and for Leanne Benjamin, many of them were held in a suitcase that had been locked away for decades.", "", "
Stephen Wicks danced with Leanne Benjamin at Sadlers Wells Royal Ballet in the early years.(Supplied: Leanne Benjamin)
", "\"It was such a gift,\" she said.", "\"I opened the suitcase just before writing the book and found all the letters from home.", "\"Thank God for the old days of writing letters, because there were masses of details that I had probably forgotten.", "\"It was a little bit daunting, looking back on my 16, 17, 18-year-old self.", "\"But at the same time, looking back on myself, I just can't believe how brave I was and to navigate such big decisions at a young age is quite incredible.", "Ms Benjamin, who lives in London with her husband and son, was forced to abandon plans to launch the book in Brisbane in October.", "But she jumped at the chance to return to her Australian family as soon as borders opened and is currently visiting her parents, who now live in Sydney."]
